result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Garcia Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:09 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Miguel A Garcia Alvarez in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
ADA Hall submits AMENDED information; Service of the AMENDED information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail (on Count #1), with Huber/Work-release privileges for purposes of employment and child care consistent with the Sheriff's rules; to commence 10/30/15 by 10:00 am  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No contact with Kevin O'Tey
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA Surcharge
--To pay $33 subpoena fees

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 9:37 am
Jury trial at 11-02-2015 or 11-03-2015 at 08:30 am
for continuance of the 6/9/15 FSSC & 6/15/15 Jury Trial
Jury trial on June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 10:15 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Miguel A Garcia Alvarez in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Liesl Monroy sworn as Spanish Inerpreter. 
Atty Colques informs the Court that a resolution has not been reached, requests matter be set for trial
Counsel agree 1 days is needed for trial
Court confirms address in file is accurate
Recess: 10:17 am 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule FSSC 6/9/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 6/15/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 11:08 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Miguel A Garcia Alvarez in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Garcia Alvarez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Court for the record notes that Mr. Garcia Alvarez has been answering in English, but unaware if he is understanding the Court or the interpreter.
Atty Colque indicates that Mr. Garcia Alvarez does need an interpreter for all future hearings 
Recess: 11:13 am 

NEXT: (1) STC scheduled for 5/15/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
Status conference on March 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 18, 2015 at 11:40 am.

Reserve Judge O'Brien presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 11:07am. [MK]
Defendant Miguel A Garcia Alvarez in court with Attorney Erik I. Colque.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
On Motion of ADA Hall, the Court amends the Criminal Complaint to change the statute to:  943.201(2)(a), and further, the Court strikes the words "to avoid civil or criminal process or penalty " and replaces this with the words "to obtain services or employment". 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to possess personal identifying information of another person 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
Attorney Colque indicates that Mr. Garcia Alvarez has understood the proceedings today, but a Spanish Interpreter is requested for future hearings. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Garcia Alvarez that he has understood the proceedings today. 
recess 11:13am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/18/15 at 11:40am   (2) Status Conference on 3/13/15 at 10:00am
